text:
For actors in the show business, a large part of their fate depends on their choices. When they are at their highest point, they are flooded with offers and the choices they make decides their future course of stardom.
For Akshay Kumar, doing five films a year is manageable. He has established himself as one of the most bankable stars and with back to back hits, it's every filmmaker's dream to work with him.
Twitter
But even with back to back mega hits, there is a regret that he recently spoke about. Akshay was attending HT's most stylish awards when he made a confession about making a choice that he regrets about till today. Well, not many know that before Farhan Akhtar was roped in for Bhaag Milkha Bhaag, the role was initially offered to Akshay Kumar.
Agencies
Talking at the HT's most stylish red-carpet, Akshay revealed,
Instagram

“Actually, I regret not doing a film. It was Bhaag Milkha Bhaag. I was offered that film but I opted for Once Upon A Time In Mumbai Dobara”.
Considering how actors constantly remain in the spotlight for what they say and do, admitting a mistake or a regret definitely would have taken a little bit of courage! But nonetheless, Akshay is still ruling the box-office and the success of Kesari proves just that.
title: 6 Years After Its Release, Akshay Kumar Admits He Regrets Turning Down 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag'!
